You can target these lines to start using the `grid-row` and `grid-column` properties to determine where you should place an item. Here's how you can make the first grid item occupy the first two columns: +:::interactive_editor + +```html + +

+``` + ```css +.grid { + display: grid; + grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr); /* 4 equal columns */ + grid-template-rows: repeat(3, 100px); /* 3 equal rows */ + gap: 10px; +} + +.grid > div { + display: grid; + place-items: center; + background: crimson; + color: white; + font-size: 4rem; +} + .item1 { grid-column: 1 / 3; } ``` +::: + With this, you're saying the first grid item should start at column 1 and end just before column 3. The first item will now occupy two columns, and the fourth item gets pushed to the second row. Cool!
